page.title: 03WHIMPLE SCHOOL ** HISTORY
page.content: The first reference to schooling in Whimple apppears in 1798 when there were appparently 3 or 4 Dame schools. In 1818 there was a school of 48 children.The present day school started life in 1848 under the name of "Whimple National School" and was built at the cost of Â£475. It comprised of a teacher's house and a single schoolroom. In 1870 the schoolroom was enlarged and an infant classroom added. By 1910 the school had been enlarged again with a further room being added. It had by now achieved its resent two modern mobile classrooms which are quite separate from the main school buildings.
